title: Is it possible for two different books to have the same name? - Quora

response.answer_text: The answer is, of course yes. A Google search brought up dozens of offerings that were duplicates (an alarming number of them romance novels.) Publishers usually do a title check but I'm sure from time to time something slips through the cracks. The trick from an author's perspective is to have a title that is unique. Pretty unlikely to find another book named "A Series of Unfortunate Events: The Bad Beginning" however a book just titled "The Bad Beginning" is a lot more likely to be duplicated.    For an example do a search for the book "Heart of Darkness," in addition to the Conrad classic there is another book from a series by Gena Showalter, and a graphic novel as well.
Yes. I just found out when I was looking for The Woman Next Door and found that two different women had written books with that name.
